properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 9 at 3:29AM CST by NWS Huntsville AL
properties.description:
Several rounds of heavy rainfall are expected between Monday and
Thursday as a series of disturbances interact with a stalled
frontal boundary. Thunderstorms are also expected during this
time and will locally increase rainfall amounts. The combination
of saturated soils from recent rainfall, and still swollen
rivers, creeks, and streams, will increase the threat for
flooding.

Rainfall totals Monday and Tuesday could reach 2.5 to 4 inches,
with locally higher amounts up to 5 inches possible. Another 2 to
3 inches of rain will be possible Wednesday and Thursday as
another frontal system impacts the region. It is important to note
that these values may change depending on exactly where the front
stalls.

A Flood Watch is in effect for the entire Tennessee Valley region
from 6 AM Monday to 6 PM Tuesday. Residents should continue to
monitor this unfolding weather situation and stay tuned to
further forecast updates from the National Weather Service.

For additional hydrologic information, visit our website at
weather.gov/huntsville.

NWSheadline: Widespread Flooding Possible Monday through Thursday across the Tennessee Valley
